channel.title: Dropping items?

item.title: Dropping items?
item.dc:creator: @Venomblood Venomblood
item.description:
@Venomblood wrote:

I’m confused with the Findbitmap function. Can you show an example of it? Do I have to have to have a picture of the rune essence I’m powermining?

Read full topic

item.title: Dropping items?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Venomblood:

Okay thankyou, I have one more question. I’m trying to drop the item but the coordinates keep messing up. Is there an easier way to do this?

XD, Sorry. I didn’t release you only wanted to drop four times.

Yes, Akumas would work, but sometimes it screws up. I suggest using something like while FindBitmap(theitem) do begin Mouse(x,y,false) ChooseOption(x,y,‘drop’);

Thats just basic, and you would have to edit it to work, but thats what I would use for dropping.

And to get rid of the unkown identifier error download SRL, and include it at the top of your script: {.include SRL\SRL.scar} Then have SetupSRL; in your main loop.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropping items?
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

For the number of times I would suggest Cheezy’s third suggestion. Its a bit cleaner then declaring a “times” variable and scripting in:
[scar]
var
times :integer;

begin
times :=0;
repeat
DoStuff;
times:= times + 1;
until(times = 12058410854);
end.
[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Dropping items?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[scar]repeat
DoStuff;
until (False);[/scar]

or:

[scar]while 0=0 do
begin
DoStuff;
end;[/scar]

or:
[scar]
var i: integer;
for i:=0 to 123123423512512345 do begin
DoStuff;
end;[/scar]

I suggest using the first one.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropping items?
item.dc:creator: @Venomblood Venomblood
item.description:
@Venomblood wrote:

I am working on a script to auto do something. I want a certain section to loop forever (or a number of times). How can I do this?
EDIT
I am trying to make it drop the first 4 items, but it isn’t working. It misses when it tries to click on it. Here is the dropping code.

procedure Drop; begin MoveMouse(715,376); HumanClick2; Wait(300); GetMousePos(Currentposition1,Currentposition2); MoveMouse(Currentposition1-20,(Currentposition2+30)) HumanClick1; Wait(300); MoveMouse(755,376); HumanClick2; Wait(300); GetMousePos(Currentposition1,Currentposition2); MoveMouse(Currentposition1-30,(Currentposition2+30)) HumanClick1; Wait(300+random(100)); MoveMouse(795,376); HumanClick2; Wait(300+random(90)); GetMousePos(Currentposition1,Currentposition2); MoveMouse(Currentposition1-40,(Currentposition2+30)) HumanClick1; Wait(300+random(142)); MoveMouse(835,376); HumanClick2; Wait(300+random(14)); GetMousePos(Currentposition1,Currentposition2); MoveMouse(Currentposition1-40,(Currentposition2+30)) HumanClick1; Wait(300+random(114)); MoveMouse(Mouseposition1,Mouseposition2); Wait(200+random(100)); end;

Read full topic
